trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of a pilot support intervention for informal caregivers of people with motor neuron disease on psychological morbidity
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of a pilot support intervention for informal caregivers of people with motor neuron disease on psychological morbidity

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of normal psychology, cognitive function and behaviour

interventions.interventions: This is a one-off group based intervention with a duration of two hours thirty minutes. The purpose of this group based activity will be to create a supportive environment to share personal experiences about changes to the caregiver's life associated with caring for a person with Motor Neuron Disease. It will also provide a supportive environment to learn about mindfulness, problem solving and other support resources available. The intervention will be administered by two psychologists to a small group of caregivers.
interventions.comparator: There is no control group. The same intervention is applied to all subjects in the study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Outcome 1: Cognitive and Affective Mindfulness Scale-Revised score
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint 1 (baseline) and timepoint 3 (two months after intervention)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Outcome 1: Acceptability of intervention questionnaire. Assessed by brief survey created by the Researchers of the study (it is not a formal / previously validated tool).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint 2 (within 1 week of intervention) and timepoint 3 (two months after intervention)

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Diagnosed with a severe cognitive or psychological disorder; 2. Unaware of the diagnosis of the person they care for.

trial_design.statisticalmethods: Descriptive analyses will summarise the sample and the evaluation form. Paired samples t tests will be used to compare the data from the questionnaire booklet before and after the intervention, however, results will be interpreted with caution given this is a pilot study.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study aims to develop, provide and evaluate a new group based activity for people who provide care for someone with Motor Neuron Disease. The purpose of this group based activity will be to create a supportive environment to share personal experiences about changes to the caregiver's life associated with caring for a person with Motor Neuron Disease. It will also provide a supportive environment to learn about mindfulness, problem solving and other support resources available. The intervention will be administered by two psychologists to a small group of caregivers.
ethicsAndSummary.publicnotes: The ethics application for the study has been submitted. We have had a delayed response and we expect approval to be obtained at the end of February and will update this account when able.
